snippet.description:
A deeper philosophical look into the spiritual significance of AI. In this video we see how AI is an external manifestation of human nature. Understanding this is fundamental so that humanity may use this technology more consciously as it continues to make technological advancements. Otherwise, humanity will fall into unconscious identification and fascination with it. Enjoy this visual journey, reflecting on how the nature of AI can reveal the big questions of "what is ego?" and "can artificial intelligence become self aware?"...

snippet.title: Guided Meditation Exercise for Conscious Imagination
snippet.description:
This visualization technique exercises our innate faculty of imagination, developing conscious control of our imagination. Usually, lower aspects of our psyche (ego) unconsciously controls our imagination (clairvoyance), but with this meditation, we gradually learn to take conscious control of our inner vision, thus learning to becoming more conscious of our inner vision, as well as being able to see and choose how and what we use our imagination for. Doing this exercise daily will increase the chances of astral projection and recalling past lives. The suggested links in the description are highly recommended for deeper understanding and study.

üéôÔ∏è This is a clip from our live monthly group meditations. If you want to attend, just join through Patreon üëâ https://www.patreon.com/astraldoorway

‚ùóÔ∏è This audio should act as an example tutorial of how to do this simple exercise. Thereafter, you can practice it yourself in your own time, at your own intuitive pace‚Äîideally practicing once a day. 

ü´Å The breathwork in the beginning is very simple: Inhale for 5 seconds, retain for 5 seconds, exhale for 5 seconds, repeat. This is a powerful yet simple form of pranayama. snippet.description:
This is part two of how to remember past lives. We look into the power of astral projection and a detailed look at how past lives can be experienced, along with anecdotes of personal experiences. We see how to better prepare ourselves for practice, and the importance of letting go of both good and bad expectations of what we might see; because in the end, all of our past lives contain both good and bad memories. We look at how crucial it is to be willing to face our own fears and "The Guardian of the Threshold". Various spiritual practices are recommended in the video, such as self-observation and sexual transmutation & alchemy (Kundalini), and both basic and advanced techniques for recalling past lives are given at the end.

snippet.title: Astral Projection Mantra FA RA ON ‚Äì Awaken Consciousness Out of the Body (One Hour)
snippet.description:
Practice astral travel by mentally chanting this mantra alongside this audio while falling asleep. Every time we sleep, we leave our physical bodies and dream in the astral plane unconsciously. Astral projection is simply about leaving the body consciously so that we no longer dream while asleep, and instead, explore the higher dimensions of reality with our consciousness awake. Astral projection is not dangerous, it is a natural birthright of all human beings. Mentally recite this mantra as you doze off peacefully to sleep, keeping the intention in your heart to experience the astral world consciously. This audio is simply an accompaniment to your practice. Your intention should be to go fully beyond the physical senses, including the sound or visuals of this video, in order to reach the non-physical state of consciousness that exists beyond the body. Be sure that you are sufficiently tired and relaxed before practicing. You must pass through the drowsiness of sleep in order to "unbottle" the consciousness from the physical body.

snippet.description:

This video reveals that there are, in fact, seven Kundalinis; each one belonging to an entirely different Body of our Being within us. snippet.title: Bodhisattvas In Arms: The Difficult Path (Poem)
snippet.description:
In the beginning we renounce the entire world,
Drowned in bitterness by the pain of existence,
Seeking desperately for the promised pearl,
We march forward with terrible persistence.

Seeking in the darkness amidst the muck,
We pray and pray to our Innermost Divinity,
It seems almost every turn brings a stroke of bad luck,       
Longing forever and ever for the world of Infinity.

Although we would like all the answers immediately,
At first we begin to see the dark tests of our Karma,
‚ÄúYou must face your trials and tests‚Äù says Divinity,
In hopes that one day we generate our Dharma.

Upon walking down the treacherous Path,
One faces the dangers of the ‚ÄúI‚Äôs‚Äù wrath.
It seems at times there could be no way out,
Like exploring deep caves shouting ‚Äúlet me out!‚Äù

Even envy fills the heart when we see others progress,
But we have never walked in another man‚Äôs shoes,
So our judgements are not a reason to digress,
Unless we would like to abuse and confuse,
Our comrade‚Äôs path if we choose.

Among the cries of such a terrible Path,
We find intriguing beings that make us laugh.
‚ÄúWho are you?‚Äù we ask,
‚ÄúI am you‚Äù, as They reveal their mask.

Confusion we feel when contemplating the Masters,
As we go through the trials of our own disasters‚Ä¶
But for our brothers and sisters we learn to sacrifice,
With our selfish ways being the only price.

Only then is our pain lessened through Unity,
For we FINALLY realize there is no ‚ÄúI‚Äù in ‚ÄúWe‚Äù,
And ‚ÄúWe‚Äù hear the silent voice: ‚ÄúYou are in Me.‚Äù

‚Ä¶With a heart sweetened by the honey of God,
We resolve to renounce our filthy mud.
We no longer cry down the dark caves within,
But resolve to help others to find the strength to begin,
This difficult Path by holding hands as kin‚Ä¶
Guided by the Bodhisattvas we find ourselves in.

In the end we realize love for the world and humanity,
And no longer renounce our friends and family,
But willingly live in the heart of everyone‚Äôs calamity,
Shining light through the fire of alchemy!

Bitterness is the beginning,
Sweetness is the end,
We hear the bells ringing,
Being held by a friend.

Trust and faith directs our path,
Guided by a sacrificial heart,
No longer using the mind to calculate math,
Realizing no progress is made apart.

The peace of God resounds deeply in the Being,
Spreading the aroma of harmony unto all forms,
Allowing all people to experiencing Seeing,
Witnessing Nature‚Äôs power to transform.

When stillness reigns,
Pure awe is it to see,
Unshackling the chains,
From the mind‚Äôs false decrees.

When stillness reigns,
A simple breath liberates,
The Christ within our veins,
Only our Mother awaits,
For our innocence to shine forth,
In death we find the power of rebirth.

Death, birth and sacrifice,
What more does God want,
Unless we want a fool‚Äôs paradise,
There‚Äôs no time to think twice,
Less we fall into vice.

Make way for God‚Äôs March until the end
Reaching out to overextend,
And comprehend the real way to ascend,
Totally absorbed in God‚Äôs love,
Far, far above self-love,
And deep, deep into the great beyond,
Where only the highest masters may respond.

Abiding forever in the way of the Trinity,
Thank you, thank you, my protector, O Divinity,
Guide me, guide me on my way, O Infinity.

snippet.title: How to Meditate on Ego: Psychological Death (Gnostic Psychoanalysis) - Guided Meditation
snippet.description:
This is an educational guided meditation on ego death, intended to be used once or twice. Afterwards, apply this technique independently at your own pace so that you can work more intuitively.

0:00 - Introductory Reading & Basic Outline of the Practice
2:18 - Fundamental Theory on the Dissolution of the Psychological "I's"
14:29 - Guided Meditation (Relaxation, Pranayama & Psychoanalysis)

üéß There is a shorter variation of this type of meditation found on the 'Wisdom of Gnosis' YouTube channel. Depending on who you are, you may find this version more helpful: https://youtu.be/iSMIsF2oleU

Resources:
üëâ Gnostic Psychoanlysis Part 1: https://glorian.org/learn/courses-and-lectures/beginning-here-and-now/gnostic-psychoanalysis-part-1
üëâ Gnostic Psychoanlysis Part 2: https://glorian.org/learn/courses-and-lectures/beginning-here-and-now/gnostic-psychoanalysis-part-2
üëâ Laws of Being (Glorian YouTube): https://youtu.be/K9Ozn3SZRMM
üëâ Self-Observation & Self-Remembering: https://glorian.org/learn/courses-and-lectures/beginning-here-and-now/self-observation-and-self-remembering
üëâ Key of SOL: https://youtu.be/CJL25ts5628
üëâ How to Kill the Ego: https://youtu.be/ysSKce1cA70
üëâ Sexual Transmutation & Alchemy: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLbZsCM6xnLIUGQcs_E43BJtC4gUoS6VO1

üìñ How to Cultivate Virtues and Eradicate Vices by Swami Sivananda PDF: https://drive.google.com/file/d/10qaGLn8V-eC_ezCG9i-vmAVSmU8uBGw5

Once one begins to understand how to illuminate the light of consciousness onto ego, and has full recognition that we are not egoic perceptions, then one can much better connect with, and identify with, the sacred space of Being, and enjoy the natural love and happiness that comes with choosing to abide in this "Inner Home", where the source of our deepest wisdom resides.

This is understood when we learn how to dissolve the psychological elements that keep our awareness conditioned and "asleep". In the beginning, the technique in this audio may feel like an "intellectual exercise", but with consistent effort, the practice will move into "the heart". Then we can apply this type of "cultivated self-illuminating awareness" more intuitively to every ego-perception that presents itself to the canvas of the mind, profoundly deepening and accelerating our journey of Self-realization.

This type of meditation shows us, in a deep way, the difference between thoughts and awareness. Most of us are trapped in thoughts, very few know how to truly live in awareness. To think that we can go immediately into a permanent state of awakened consciousness is a fallacy of the mind. We must first learn about ourselves through in-depth self-comprehension. Then can we gradually liberate the mind from the many psychological elements and identifications that we call the ego. This is akin to shining a torch in a dark corridor to reveal the path ahead of us. In other words, we learn to shine the light of consciousness into the darkness of ego.

After completing this meditation, pay attention to your dreams when you next sleep, as it‚Äôs expected you would have ‚Äúshifted‚Äù a lot of things internally and it‚Äôs likely that more answers to self-comprehension may come in the form of powerful symbols and metaphors. These types of vivid dreams include hidden clues from the Astral to help you understand your soul‚Äôs challenges in a deeper way.

The basic outline of this method is:
‚Ä¢ Relaxation & pranayama (5 second box breath is used for pranayama & ‚Äòconnecting to solar energy‚Äô visualization is used for deep body relaxation. Note: you can use your own preferred pranayama or body relaxation technique)
‚Ä¢ Recalling & re-living the memory of an ego-experience (Observation & Comprehension)
‚Ä¢ Connecting to Divinity/Kundalini for help (Judgement & Elimination)
‚Ä¢ Mantra "KRIM" 13 times (Optional but recommended)

Note: The more challenging/dense an ego you choose, the greater the result of consciousness that will be liberated. Clues to identifying strongly rooted ego-patterns are found when we feel emotions such as guilt, shame, or remorse in relation to actions we committed during unconscious moments in our waking life.

"Felicia is a curious student of this current experience. After many experiences as a child and adult, and a deep connection to an inner divine thread, she was always called to study the esoteric and occult sciences. She particularly loves the work of the brilliant OGs like Rudolf Steiner. She is also a woman, friend, sister, birth keeper, doula, mizan therapist, astrologer, artist, and adventurer. She is also the host of Wisdom Weavers Podcast. She's from NYC but has lived in Europe the last few years, in a more adventurous, nomadic way. Birth keeping has led the way. She's supported dozens of births and birthing women + their partners + their families. She has also supported people dealing with loss, and believes the line between birth and death is quite thin. Both must be honored. No matter what she does in this world, the form may change, but the essence is the same, to self-realize and to be of service to women, children, humanity and to this planet."

Discover the three essential ingredients to revolutionize and awaken consciousness: a path of love which involves internal death, spiritual birth, and helping humanity. The three factors are the keys to transform our lives into a greater purpose:
‚Ä¢ Death: purification of pride, anger, lust, envy, etc
‚Ä¢ Birth: liberation and actualizion of virtue and right action
‚Ä¢ Sacrifice: attainment of service, charity, selflessness, bodhichitta, etc

In Mahayana and Tantrayana Buddhism, these three factors are taught in the following order:
‚Ä¢ Death: to cease harmful action and eliminate its causes
‚Ä¢ Birth: to adopt virtuous action and support its causes
‚Ä¢ Sacrifice: to work for the benefit of others

snippet.title: The Gnostic Method App Release: Awaken Your Consciousness
snippet.description:
If you have been searching for the light to find the real path hidden within our consciousness, and you have the calling to 'Know Thyself', then this resource may be the key for you to discover that which lies at the root of all religion and spirituality: Gnosis.

üëâ Download the app: https://thegnosticmethod.beezer.com/
üëâ Image invitation poster: https://i.imgur.com/n1IWNWb.jpg
üëâ PDF version of poster: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1wdP5ObA_eeRozE1vwkNDQYgFt6Fo-R36/

üôè

In my friend's words:

"Thought" is the master of all illusions.

"Mind" is the maker of all forms.

Motion births resistance.

Esoteric Resistance gives birth to light.

The kingdom awaits the rebel eagles.

Those who open their solar wings to golden flights.

The place where two forces cross [X] in love, is the beginning and the end.

From death comes a rebirth. A simple kiss [X] holds all this wisdom.

From darkness comes light.¬†

My friends, to find the Atma-Vidya we must first descend into the chaotic waters.¬†

The error of so many is to try first to ascend, without first having descended.

But they fail to be reborn. And stay in the wheel.

Light falls, then light ascends upon the reflection of the waters.

Water is the substance of love.

Fire is the Will inside it the expansion of infinity.

Yes there is indeed Fire in the Waters. 

A kiss holds as its motif the holy X.

To find the real treasure, X marks the spot.

The cross holds the father of all gods at its heart.

Life after life, we miss "this center". Our aim is shaken, the bulls eye missed.

The ox ploughs the fields in vain. So much effort and for what?¬†

Our veins flow like the river Nile, no longer in the green pastures of the golden age, but in the dust and heat of the Kali Yuga.

Our inner pyramid becomes lost to the sands of the day.

My brothers and sisters, do not let this happen!¬†

Seize this day! Grab hold of your soul!

But what good is knowledge without love?

What good is our burning will without the cool waters that heal our hearts?

Our hearts are black, surrounded by words that have no life.

But then, in the solitude and dark night of our incessant manifestations, a kiss (X) falls on our heart!

The Word at the beginning.

A truth! A light! A thundering sound!

A beauty beyond all imagination, but also an esoteric death we must secretly attend.

Ah!I see! I see! Light, you are blinding!

A light that cannot be seen with the normal eyes but beats and pounds on my walls of ignorance.

It cracks and falls.

The cross is seen on the mountain of life.

The truth is a torch that leads to its summit.

The kiss that gives all and takes all is here, as it always was, but we could not see it.

Faith is born, but we do not believe.
A candle dispels the darkness in the room; it is a fact.

What else is there to do but love?

What else is there to do but become light?

What else is there to do but shine light in the darkness and become the candle that shows the way?

How strange? There is ‚Äúno one‚Äù here doing anything! The candle lit itself.¬†

A living inner spark ignites.

The living yeast of fire raises the bread up to heaven and brings heaven into our daily bread.

Oh!¬†Friends. May our lives be a ‚Äúframe‚Äù for this power of love each day.

May our souls become the ‚Äúgolden cornerstones‚Äù of a new city of celestial peace.¬†

To all my dear brothers and sisters, I advise, enter into yourselves, here and now.

The unspeakable Truth¬†awaits you.

Glory to the Masters of light who have clearly shown us "The Way."

The temple of the heart stands before you.

Knock and the door will be opened.

X

snippet.title: 1 Hour Heart Sutra Mantra Recitation: Gate Gate Paragate Parasamgate Bodhi Svaha
snippet.description:
Watch this video first: https://youtu.be/g3YGCHVK6nU

Prajnaparamita, or The Heart of Wisdom Sutra:

The Blessed One [Buddha Shakyamuni] was staying in Rajgriha at Vulture Peak along with a great community of monks and a great community of bodhisattvas, and at that time, the Blessed One entered the meditative absorption on the varieties of phenomena called the appearance of the profound. At that time as well, the noble Avalokiteshvara, the bodhisattva, the great being, clearly beheld the practice of the profound perfection of wisdom itself and saw that even the five aggregates are empty of intrinsic existence.

Thereupon, through the Buddha's inspiration, the venerable Shariputra spoke to the noble Avalokiteshvara, the bodhisattva, the great being, and said, "How should any noble son or noble daughter who wishes to engage in the practice of the profound perfection of wisdom train?"

When this had been said, the holy Avalokiteshvara, the bodhisattva, the great being, spoke to the venerable Shariputra and said, "Shariputra, any noble son or noble daughter who so wishes to engage in the practice of the profound perfection of wisdom should clearly see this way: they should see perfectly that even the five aggregates are empty of intrinsic existence. Form is emptiness, emptiness is form; emptiness is not other than form, form too is not other than emptiness. Likewise, feelings, perceptions, mental formations, and consciousness are all empty. Therefore, Shariputra, all phenomena are emptiness; they are without defining characteristics; they are not born, they do not cease; they are not defiled, they are not undefiled; they are not deficient, and they are not complete.

Therefore, Shariputra, in emptiness there is no form, no feelings, no perceptions, no mental formations, and no consciousness. There is no eye, no ear, no nose, no tongue, no body, and no mind. There is no form, no sound, no smell, no taste, no texture, and no mental objects. There is no eye-element and so on up to no mind-element including up to no element of mental consciousness. There is no ignorance, there is no extinction of ignorance, and so on up to no aging and death and no extinction of aging and death. Likewise, there is no suffering, origin, cessation, or path; there is no wisdom, no attainment, and even no non-attainment.

Therefore, Shariputra, since bodhisattvas have no attainments, they rely on this perfection of wisdom and abide in it. Having no obscuration in their minds, they have no fear, and by going utterly beyond error, they will reach the end of nirvana. All the buddhas too who abide in the three times attained the full awakening of unexcelled, perfect enlightenment by relying on this profound perfection of wisdom.

Therefore, one should know that the mantra of the perfection of wisdom - the mantra of great knowledge, the unexcelled mantra, the mantra equal to the unequalled, the mantra that quells all suffering - is true because it is not deceptive. The mantra of the perfection of wisdom is proclaimed:

tadyatha gat√© gat√© paragat√© parasamgat√© bodh√≠ svaha!

Shariputra, the bodhisattvas, the great beings, should train in the perfection of wisdom in this way.

Thereupon, the Blessed One arose from that meditative absorption and commended the holy Avalokiteshvara, the bodhisattva, the great being, saying this is excellent. "Excellent! Excellent! O noble child, it is just so; it should be just so. One must practice the profound perfection of wisdom just as you have revealed. For then even the tathagatas will rejoice.

As the Blessed One uttered these words, the venerable Shariputra, the holy Avalokiteshvara, the bodhisattva, the great being, along with the entire assembly, including the worlds of gods, humans, asuras, and gandharvas, all rejoiced and hailed what the Blessed One had said.

~~~~~~~

snippet.title: Finding The Great Emptiness: The Power of Perfect Wisdom
snippet.description:
The Prajnaparamita, or Heart Sutra, is one of the most powerful and transcendental teachings that the great Buddha Shakyamuni left us. It enables us to find the ultimate, or root, reality. With it, he left one of the most powerful mantras which has acted as a fundamental basis to many schools of Buddhism. This mantras helps us to reach that which is called 'Sunyata', 'Emptiness', 'The Absolute', 'The Ain Soph', 'The Void', 'Samadhi' etc. The mantra is: "Gate Gate Paragate Parasamgate Bodhi Swaha".

snippet.title: The Psychological Song: A Root Cause of Mental Illness
snippet.description:
Identification with thoughts and feelings is the first root cause of all mental illness in its early stages, and without the study of oneself through self-observation it can be difficult to detach and bring higher awareness to our negative "inner atmosphere". This "atmosphere", or "inner world", can often be 'heard' and 'felt' if we are sensitive enough; and if we pay continued attention we will notice that the same 'songs' are compulsively and addictively repeated throughout our lives - forming our beliefs about reality. Becoming aware of this ultimately leads to more intimate psychological comprehension, self-knowledge and spiritual healing at a root level.

If you want to understand this episode more, try reading 'Treatise of Revolutionary Psychology' by Samael Aun Weor: https://www.amazon.com/Treatise-Revolutionary-Psychology-Spiritual-Awakening/dp/1934206768

Similarly, the four principles talked about in the video are just to give you a sense of the kind of devotion required in order to really understand the teachings. They are not strict rules per se, but rather core practices which will help us to gradually embody Gnosis at a fundamental level. For example, deep meditation gives us the clarity of mind through psychological comprehension that leads to the death of the ego, and sexual transmutation (suprasexuality) helps us to renounce the sensual pleasures of the physical world in order to have the energy to perceive and feel the suprasensual worlds (higher worlds/dimensions), which in time also creates the Solar Astral Body.

snippet.title: Guided Tummo Meditation: Buddhist Breath of Fire (HAM SA Mantra)
snippet.description:
The image on the thumbnail shows a yogi in meditation with the three channels on the spinal column. Next to his mouth is the Tibetan letter Ha ‡Ωß. Above his head is a flame, and above that flame, the letter A ‡Ω®, and from that letter A ‡Ω® we see a splendorous radiation and then an image of heaven or nirvana (click here for the full image: https://i.imgur.com/Hl2QZQu.jpg)

This image is related to a tradition called Tummo, which is a particular type of technique that is taught in a variety of schools of Buddhism. In the Gnostic tradition we call it Pranayama. There are many varieties of Pranayama exercises. The Sanskrit word Pranayama means ‚Äúto harness the winds.‚Äù It is not referring to physical wind, but ethereal wind‚Äîin other words, what we call "ether". To harness the winds is to harness energies. Those energies is shown here in this path that leads to this temple in the internal (Astral) worlds. The yogi is using mantras; these letters are A and Ha, but they did not paint the whole mantra. The whole mantra is "Ham-Sah". The sound that makes the fire is: "Ssssssssaaaahhh".

The image shows the vowel Ha ‡Ωß by his mouth. When practicing the pranayama Ham-Sah, "Ham" is the mantra we pronounce mentally when we breathe in; we breathe in the air to take the vital currents, the ethereal currents, into the body. We imagine that energy rising up the spinal column as we mentally pronounce the mantra "Haaaammmmm", and all that energy is going up the spine into the brain. This brings the waters, from the bottom to the top, the lower waters to the upper waters, the waters of sex to the waters of the brain: "Haaaammmm". Then the fire that is in the water irradiates the brain, rejuvenates it, gives it life and energy, and then the Yogi says "Ssssssssssaaaaaaahhhh" with the exhalation. In total, this causes the fire in the waters to rise to the brain, illuminate the pineal gland, and open clairvoyance, to give us the power to see beyond the physical senses. It is very beautifully illustrated in this painting.

The meditation will stop at 30 minutes but feel free to continue to say the mantras if you are enjoying it while in a deep state. Be sure to turn "Auto-play" off so another video doesn't start playing. Ads are turned off.

"Each centre in the body has its own note, and it responds when we sound it. He who sounds the proper vowels‚Äîthe seven vowels of Nature‚Äîharmonises these centres... To evoke the activity of our latent atomic centres we use the seven vowels of Nature, called mantras..."
- M, The Dayspring of Youth 

"The letter 'I' makes the pituitary and the pineal glands vibrate; thus, the human being becomes clairvoyant. The letter 'E' makes the thyroid gland vibrate; thus the human being becomes clairaudient. The letter 'O' makes the chakra of the heart vibrate; thus the human being becomes intuitive. The letter 'U' awakens the solar plexus; thus the human being awakens telepathy. The letter 'A' makes the chakra of the lungs vibrate; thus, the human being acquires the power of remembering his past lives. The letter 'M' vibrates the prostatic/uterine chakra, which grants the power to consciously depart in the Astral Body. Every student must possess such a power, if not, it is mandatory for such a student to awaken this chakra. The vowel 'S' efficiently helps in the development of all of the spiritual powers... One hour of daily vocalization is worth more than reading a million books of pseudo-spirituality."
- Samael Aun Weor

snippet.title: A Very Powerful Method for Astral Projection! (Homemade Vipassana)
snippet.description:
This is a unique and transformative practice. If you‚Äôve tried every other Astral projection technique out there and still had no success, then this method is for you. It‚Äôs for you because you‚Äôre most likely missing the bridge to the deeper spiritual dimension of consciousness that allows for these experiences to manifest more naturally. This technique is more like a home-made ‚Äúretreat‚Äù, a devotional and wholesome practice which focuses on raising your entire level of being. ‚ÄúRetreat‚Äù means to step back - not only from the outer world, but also from your head, the thinking mind. I call this 'The Presence Method'.

Even if you don't choose to practice this exact method, just contemplating what's said in this episode may help a lot, and you may incorporate these teachings into your life however you please.

‚ÄúImpeccability begins with a single act that has to be deliberate, precise and sustained. If that act is repeated long enough, one acquires a sense of unbending intent which can be applied to anything else [Astral projection]. If that is accomplished the road is clear. One thing will lead to another until the warrior realizes his full potential.‚Äù ~ Don Juan Matus (Wisdom From native American Toltec Shamanism)

üëâ Satori Awakening in Zen Buddhism: https://www.encyclopedia.com/religion/encyclopedias-almanacs-transcripts-and-maps/satori-awakening
üëâ Ego & the Principle of Conserving Energy: https://youtu.be/bAyR0pQ9sJA
üëâ Astral Projection Mantra: https://youtu.be/j6PJypJ-wtU
üëâ Spiritual Superiority: https://youtu.be/0LK1Fy6MgQE

Here‚Äôs a very short summary of this practice; these steps will only make sense if you listen to the entire episode first:

~ 1. Devote three or more days where you can practice this in solitude away from the distractions of the world and its unconscious dreams.
~ 2. Stay active, healthy, meditate often and configure your awareness to be always aware of all your senses of the physical world, as well as your internal world.
~ 3. Stay balanced, focused and grounded based on your passion to enter other worlds [Astral projection/different dimensions of consciousness]. Stay devotedly aware of your intent while old unconscious patterns, thoughts and egoic dreams try to come back into your life while you‚Äôre on this ‚Äúretreat‚Äù.
~ 4. If you‚Äôre focusing too much on future achievements during this time, say to yourself, ‚ÄúI am Astral projecting‚Äù, ‚ÄúI am in the Astral plane‚Äù. Look around in wonder, engage your higher awareness, relax, be empty, let life happen to you instead of you trying to impose a reality on it.
~ 5. As the foundations of your consciousness transform the very structure of yourself, there will be times of struggle, of going back and forth from consciousness to ego. Use the awareness of your own death as an anchor to remind you that nothing else matters in this world of illusion. Realise deeply that the past and future are not real; only the aliveness of this present moment exists here and now. Remember that the 'Astral Body' is also known as the 'Emotional Body' or 'Energy Body'; be deeply aware of internal and external emotions, energies and senses at all times.
~ 6. At night, wake up every two hours during your sleep and reconfigure your awareness back on the present moment. This is an intensive sleeping exercise to significantly boost your Astral projection experiences. You may utilise any or none Astral projection methods during any of the times you wake up and go back to sleep. Remember to recall any dreams or experiences every time you wake up.
~ 7. When you finish the three or more days, strive to bring your cultivated awareness with you back into the ordinary world in simple, silent, empty humility. Focus on peace. This entire practice will not just be beneficial for three days, it will stay with you for as long as you can honour it.

snippet.title: Astral Projection, the Ego & the Principle of Conserving Energy
snippet.description:
We take a look at some of the teachings by the native American shaman, Don Juan Matus, and how conserving spiritual energy greatly enhances our likelihood of Astral travel, and how this all naturally relates to the comprehension and transcendence of the infamous ego. Through understanding these aspects, we also gain a sense of why Astral projection may not have happened for us yet, and more deeply understand reasons why we should be more patient with ourselves on this path towards awakening consciousness.

Keep in mind that the spiritual energy saved up doesn't derive from our ego, it derives from a lack of ego, therefore it is universal energy, which is available in abundance when we open ourselves up to it and allow it to energise us. This is our natural state. It's an illusion to think we use our own egoic energy for Astral projection. This is why it's common to wake up feeling energised and healed after being out of body.

If you're interested in the native American shaman, Don Juan Matus and his wisdom, then check out the following books by Carlos Castaneda in the order below (also look up Peter Coyote for fantastic audiobook versions of some of the books):

1. The Teachings of Don Juan: A Yaqui Way of Knowledge
2. A Separate Reality: Further Conversations with Don Juan
3. Journey to Ixtlan: The Lessons of Don JuanTales of Power
4. The Second Ring of Power
5. The Eagle's Gift
6. The Power of Silence: Further Lessons of Don Juan
7. The Art of Dreaming
8. The Active Side of Infinity

After you're finished with Carlos Castaneda's book, I highly recommend reading books by Merilyn Tunneshende, who was Don Juan's second and final apprentice. Here are her books, in the order below:

1. Medicine Dream: A Nagual Woman's Energetic Healing
2. Twilight Language of the Nagual: The Spiritual Power of Shamanic Dreaming
3. Don Juan and the Art of Sexual Energy: The Rainbow Serpent of the Toltecs

As well as these, I am once again recommending the following audiobook, which covers one of the simplest way to transcend the ego - The Power of Now by Eckhart Tolle:
https://www.audible.com/pd/The-Power-of-Now-Audiobook/B002V0PN36?qid=1625312289&sr=1-1&ref=a_search_c3_lProduct_1_1&pf_rd_p=83218cca-c308-412f-bfcf-90198b687a2f&pf_rd_r=2F121WV61EHXK9SK2QJJ

snippet.title: A Call to Awakening: Discover the Power of Astral Projection
snippet.description:
What is Astral travel? What is the Astral body? Astral Projection is our natural ability to consciously leave the physical body during sleep. We explore beyond the limitations of physical reality with our Astral Body, which exists as part of our higher consciousness. Watch this motivational video for spiritual awakening, which is intended to inspire one to reach beyond the mere physicality of three-dimensional life and explore fifth-dimensional realities of consciousness; the Astral Plane.

One core approach to Astral projection is by living intensely in the present moment in physical life; by doing so, one will also begin to be more present in sleep. Consequently, one will have a much greater chance of having the profound experience of consciously leaving the body during sleep because awareness has been habitually trained to notice whether it's in physical reality or not. Being present also stops the mind from overthinking and adding unconscious 'dream-narrative' over reality, and thus you stop living mechanically and cease creating unconscious dreams. As above, so below; when you stop dreaming during the day, you stop dreaming at night. Astral projection is synonyms with the awakening of consciousness.

One powerful way to strengthen ourselves in the present moment and firmly ground our intent to Astral project is meditation. In meditation we are more able to gain clarity, focus, and plant seeds of intent into our subconscious. During meditation, you can firmly say to yourself "I WILL Astral project", feel and trust your subconscious to do the work. Expect experiences throughout your sleep, and make sure to recall any experiences that you may have had. Persistence and consistency is key.

Recommended audiobook for becoming more present: https://www.audible.ca/pd/The-Power-of-Now-Audiobook/B071RXX33T

Here's an excerpt from the book to elaborate on what I said in the video about "thinking and analyzing is becoming old-fashioned and destructive":

Questioner: "I don't want to lose my ability to analyze and discriminate. I wouldn't mind learning to think more clearly in a more focused way, but I don't want to lose my mind. The gift of thought is the most precious thing we have. Without it, we would be just another species of animal."

Eckhart Tolle: "The predominance of mind is no more than a stage in the evolution of consciousness. We need to go onto the next stage now as a matter of urgency, otherwise we will be destroyed by the mind which has grown into a monster. Thinking and consciousness are not synonymous. Thinking is only a small aspect of consciousness. Thought cannot exist without consciousness, but consciousness does not need thought. When you root yourself in consciousness, you gain more control over your mind."

Want to know the difference between lucid dreaming and Astral projection? Watch this video: https://youtu.be/H61ukQU6bpY

New to Astral Doorway? Here's an introduction to the channel: https://youtu.be/Kaovp2Gci7A

snippet.title: Guided Meditation: Cultivating Awareness & Detachment | Astral Projection Mindset
snippet.description:
Detaching our awareness from thoughts is an important practice, it's easy to get overwhelmed by them. This guided meditation can be used daily, for clarity and well-being, which naturally arises when we reclaim our awareness from compulsive thinking. We do this by anchoring ourselves in the body, the breath and the present moment, fully accepting our current emotional and mental state, and then going beyond it.

The practice of becoming more conscious of our thoughts ultimately enables us to be more aware of our dreams, and increases the ability to maintain a peaceful mind. In this freedom of mind, we are more prepared to access lucid dreaming & Astral projection, and it also helps us to maintain focus and be more grounded in these experiences.

This type of meditation can have powerful and lasting effects on the mind and body. Especially when practiced consistently as your mental strength and growing awareness spills into your daily life, and into your consciousness when you sleep.

*This is primarily a silent meditation however feel free to play musicbehind it if you wish.

*You can keep your eyes open if you like, but preferably keep them closed.
